lines.text: You see, son, it's all right to live in a cocoon like this if you expect to be a butterfly some day. Otherwise...
Call me June. It rhymes with moon.
If you hear a peculiar noise, it's my skin creeping.

[while dancing]
Do you think it might rain and cool off?

[Detached]
Such things have been known to happen.

[after a pause]
There'a a lot of nice people dancing here.

[Cynically]
This is a post office, son... full of second-class matter.

[speaking to June about his father]
Three or four haircuts ago - that's the last time I saw him.
Remember, Alex, speech was given to man to hide his thoughts.

[to Alex and June]
Let's lower our voice. We're not exactly mice.
Put nothing in writing - that's the first rule of life.
Who are you?
Who wants to know?
A man with a gun in his hands.

[speaking about his wife]
For the first six years I shaved every night before I went to bed... I thought she might come back.

[to Brady after being introduced to Mrs. Raymond]
If she cut off her head, she'd be very pretty.

[Referring to his murdered sister]
She was no lullaby but she had the brains like a man.

[Referring to the shadowy figure in the back of the cab]
Do you know this man?
I can't see him in there.
Well, get out, kind sir.

[Defiantly]
I won't!
There's a police booth down there.

[to Gus]
Listen, I don't wanna get in no trouble. I work. I'm just a parasite on parasites.

[to the gloved man]
What are you following her for?

[after losing his self-control and assaulting Alex with intent to kill]
I was in the deep water there a minute.
Golly, the misery that walks around on this pretty, quiet night!
The logic you're looking for... the logic is that there is no logic. The horror and terror you feel, my dear, comes from being alive. Die and there is no trouble. Live and you'll struggle,

[sighing in the back of Gus' cab]
Unhh...
Beg pardon?

[Distracted]
What?
You sigh like the end of summer. Troubles?
Personal.
Oh... personal. That's killed a lot of people in its day.
Yes.
Hey, by the way, if it's not too personal, what was that all about down there?
Oh, uh... uh... uh... personal.
All right, I'll buy it back. Forget I asked. Good night.
Good night.
[first lines]
Why, it's Sleepy Parsons! Aren't you dead yet?
[pours a drink]
Here's to nothin'.
[Sleepy takes out cigar]
Still on your 20 cigars a day?
[Sleepy puts cigar away]
Can't your heart take it, Sleepy?
You drunk again?
Yes.
It took you a long time to answer the door.
Hahahahahahahahaha. It's a great relief being divorced from you, Sleepy dear.

[In Edna's flat]
Do you hear anything?
Only your breathing.
Is that what that is?
Yes - and mine.

[Walking into Edna's appartment and seeing that she has been strangled]
I hear the whistle blowing.
[after a pause]
Who did it? You?
You mean you think I did it?
Didn't you?
Don't look at me like that. I think I'd better leave.
This is New York, where hello means goodbye.
People with wax heads should keep out of the sun.

[angrily to the bouncer]
Why don't you ask him why he's wearing those white gloves? He's been givin' me the itch all night.

[nervously]
No, it's a misunderstanding.

[contemptuously]
He's got a rash on his hands.

[angrily]
Is that a fact?

[desperately]
No, it's a nervous condition.

[Looking over Edna's correspondence]
The Divine Being made many loathesome creatures but none so low as a woman with a cold heart. She held these letters for blackmail... even her own brother.
[Looking at the photographs on the wall]
A blind man can see how many boyfriends she had. Evidently the water tasted good, so she jumped down the well.
